triples.name: Policy Iteration
triples.relevance: Policy iteration is a foundational algorithm in control theory that the paper extends to probabilistic Boolean networks with average cost criteria.

triples.name: Boolean Network
triples.relevance: Boolean networks are discrete dynamical systems that form the base framework for the control problem studied in the paper.

triples.name: Optimal Control
triples.relevance: Optimal control theory provides the mathematical framework for finding control laws that minimize a cost function for dynamical systems.

triples.name: Full State Feedback
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel optimal state feedback law derived through policy iteration for probabilistic Boolean control networks.

triples.name: Jordan Normal Form
triples.relevance: Jordan decomposition is a mathematical technique used in the paper to analyze and solve the optimality equations.

triples.name: Laurent Series
triples.relevance: Laurent series expansion is a mathematical technique employed in the paper to express and solve the nested optimality equations.
